content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-254-03-B
|Item_parent=Nutritional needs of pregnant women
|Item_parent_short=Nutritional needs of pregnant women
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing how to prevent spina bifida
|Description=Vitamin B9
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
Folic acid (vitamin B9) supplementation is systematically recommended at a rate of 400 µg/d, 28 days before conception and up to 12 weeks gestation.

question.title: Folic acid supplementation during pregnancy
question.description: At what stage of pregnancy is folic acid supplementation recommended?

option_a.title: At 1-2 months of gestation
option_a.description: Folic acid supplementation begins after the first two months of pregnancy.

option_b.title: 28 days before conception and up to 12 weeks gestation
option_b.description: Folic acid supplementation is recommended throughout the entire pregnancy.

option_c.title: At 12-14 weeks of gestation
option_c.description: Folic acid supplementation is recommended during the second trimester only.

option_d.title: After 20 weeks of gestation
option_d.description: Folic acid supplementation is no longer necessary after the 20th week of pregnancy.

correct_option.title: 28 days before conception and up to 12 weeks gestation
